s.text: Therefore, the transfections were repeated multiple times to control for variability in transfection efficiency.
These results suggest a cooperative role between the TCF and C/EBP? transcription factors in regulation of the c-fos SRE in response to Ras-dependent signaling pathways.
These data suggest that both Elk-1 and p35-C/EBP? are necessary for maximal Ras-stimulated transactivation of the SRE.

One possible explanation for this result is that Ras increases the amount of p35-C/EBP? or Elk-1 protein in the COS-7 cells, but Western blot analysis showed that both p35-C/EBP? and Elk-1 protein levels are the same in the absence and presence of Ras (data not shown).

One possible explanation for this result is that Ras increases the amount of p35-C/EBP? or Elk-1 protein in the COS-7 cells, but Western blot analysis showed that both p35-C/EBP? and Elk-1 protein levels are the same in the absence and presence of Ras (data not shown).

One possible explanation for this result is that Ras increases the amount of p35-C/EBP? or Elk-1 protein in the COS-7 cells, but Western blot analysis showed that both p35-C/EBP? and Elk-1 protein levels are the same in the absence and presence of Ras (data not shown).

There is most likely a large protein complex assembled at the SRE composed of regulated transcription factors, coactivators, and the basal transcriptional machinery, resulting in rapid transcription of the c-fos gene in response to mitogenic stimulation.

SRF and TCF have been shown to form a ternary complex at the SRE in vitro . We as yet have not been able to observe a ternary complex between SRF and p35-C/EBP? at the SRE in vitro . The mechanisms of SRE transactivation described above may help to explain the in vitro results.

2, when p35-C/EBP? is co-transfected with the reporter construct, there is a 13-fold increase in CAT activity in the absence of activated Ras that is increased to 24-fold when CMV-Ras.V12 is co-transfected.

When CMV-LAP (which encodes p35-C/EBP?) is transfected with GAL4-SRF and the reporter construct, we see a 7-fold increase in CAT activity that is potentiated to 75-fold when activated Ras is cotransfected.

When CMV-LAP (which encodes p35-C/EBP?) is transfected with GAL4-SRF and the reporter construct, we see a 7-fold increase in CAT activity that is potentiated to 75-fold when activated Ras is cotransfected.
Therefore, when activated Ras is transfected with Elk-1, GAL4-SRF, and the reporter, the CAT activity increases to 8-fold over basal levels.

When CMV-LAP (which encodes p35-C/EBP?) is transfected with GAL4-SRF and the reporter construct, we see a 7-fold increase in CAT activity that is potentiated to 75-fold when activated Ras is cotransfected.

When CMV-LAP (which encodes p35-C/EBP?) is transfected with GAL4-SRF and the reporter construct, we see a 7-fold increase in CAT activity that is potentiated to 75-fold when activated Ras is cotransfected.
The values of fold activation varied from as low as 60-fold to as high as 725-fold over basal levels, and we are unsure of the reason for this variability.
The values of fold activation varied from as low as 60-fold to as high as 725-fold over basal levels, and we are unsure of the reason for this variability.

2, when p35-C/EBP? is co-transfected with the reporter construct, there is a 13-fold increase in CAT activity in the absence of activated Ras that is increased to 24-fold when CMV-Ras.V12 is co-transfected.

When CMV-LAP (which encodes p35-C/EBP?) is transfected with GAL4-SRF and the reporter construct, we see a 7-fold increase in CAT activity that is potentiated to 75-fold when activated Ras is cotransfected.
The TCF family members Elk-1 [ 7], SAP-1 [ 8], and SAP-2/ERP/NET [ 9, 10] have been found to have a role in regulating the SRE.
When CMV-Elk-1 is co-transfected with the SRE reporter construct, there is no additional stimulation in transactivation in either the absence or presence of Ras compared to the reporter alone.

One possible explanation for this result is that Ras increases the amount of p35-C/EBP? or Elk-1 protein in the COS-7 cells, but Western blot analysis showed that both p35-C/EBP? and Elk-1 protein levels are the same in the absence and presence of Ras (data not shown).
There is only a slight increase in CAT activity in the absence of Ras.

2, when p35-C/EBP? is co-transfected with the reporter construct, there is a 13-fold increase in CAT activity in the absence of activated Ras that is increased to 24-fold when CMV-Ras.V12 is co-transfected.
When CMV-Elk-1 is cotransfected with the reporter and GAL4-SRF, there is little increase in CAT activity in the absence of activated Ras (CMV-Ras.V12).
COS-7 cells were transfected with an expression vector for a 6X histidine tagged construct of p35-C/EBP? carrying the ? 10 (T7 tag) epitope sequence either in the presence or absence of Elk-1.
